result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mallory J McDonald

records.addlTxt:
9:48 AM cases 22CF110, 22CF647 called. Prosecuting Attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mallory J McDonald in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard. Attorney Rivard requests a preliminary hearing in 22CF647. (22CF110 is to ride along)
Hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(9:01 AM cases 22CF110, 22CF647 called.) Defendant Mallory J McDonald does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Mallory J McDonald. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State advises neither the State nor Attorney Rivard are aware of how or when this hearing date was scheduled as the last time in court the settlement conference was scheduled for October 3 and Hearing scheduled for October 24 and defendant was present when those dates were set.
Attorney Rivard advises contact with the defendant has been sporadic.
Parties request to keep October dates on the calendar, Court orders those dates will remain.

Cases called at 11:14 AM:  22CF647 and 22CF110.
Defendant Mallory J McDonald appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Warrants quashed. Bonds continue. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/3/22 at 1:45 PM.
RTN: 10/24/22 at 9:30 AM.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:16 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mallory J McDonald not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Mallory J McDonald. 
State requests a warrant- so ordered.

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Case called at 9:46 AM) Defendant Mallory McDonald appears in person with Attorney Francis Rivard. ADA Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading, and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts- requests Status Conference. Court receives Not Guilty pleas on all counts. 
Status Conference: 07/25/2022 at 3:00 PM.

(Case called at 9:32 AM) Defendant Mallory J McDonald not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Mallory J McDonald.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance- has had regular correspondence with Defendant. No objection to rescheduling by State. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return on warrant on May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:19 AM Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mallory J McDonald in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Mallory J McDonald. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Case referred to Br. 1 for scheduling.
Hearing on March 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
